lines.text: Irish Coffee, easy on the coffee!
Last night, I think I slept with a woman.
I think that we should do something that makes us feel better.
What is there besides sex?
Häagen-Dazs!
Apparently God has chosen to punish me by making me work for someone who actually wants me to work.
The first picture of me in my family album, I'm two days old and my mother's breast-feeding the doctor.
Billie, this'll be hard but I need you to think of someone other than yourself for a moment...

[to Billie]
How dare you tell all your friends I'm a drunken potato-headed whore?
How do I know you don't badmouth me to your friends when I'm not there?
Because, darling, when you're not here I forget all about you.
Remember that anesthesiologist I was dating and I cheated on her with her sister? I just told her about it and she forgave me. We sat down, had a nice cup of tea, and...
[puzzled]
and I don't really remember what happened after that.
Mom, with you in A.A., are you sure it's a good idea to *drink*?
Don't be ridiculous darling, it's always a good idea to drink.
Mother, I'm in A.A. for real. I go every day. It's not a hobby, it's not a place to pick up guys - most of the time. I'm struggling with sobriety. You haven't even *met* sobriety.
Hi, I'm Billie, but all my friends call me "Oh Crap, Here Comes Billie."

I like the sound the glass makes when the bartender puts it on the counter. I like the way it feels in my hand. I bring it in close, and I can smell it, and a wave of relief goes through my body even before I take the first sip.
You're slow. I'd be on my third one by now.
Why should you get what you want when I can't get what I want?
Because life is unfair and I'm really horny.
Alright, alright, I admit it. I'm a fiscally irresponsible, emotionally unstable, former drunk. But that shouldn't *no way* prejudice your decision to maybe, you know, hopefully give me an advance?
An advance? You don't earn the money I pay you.
May I confide in you as a friend?
No.
Fine. Then as an acquaintance.
[she sighs and sits]
You know, lately, my life has been really crappy. Yeah... haven't had sex in over months, my landlord is raising my rents!
So sleep with him.

[asking for an advance]
Hey, Siddy Sid Sid... you're like the mother I never had.
Forget it.
Now you're like the mother I have.
A drink without liquor? Oh, what's the point?
How about, driving your car legally, or maybe remembering your name... Or, not pursuing a liver at the age of fifty.
Fifty? I beat the odds.
Because of me, you lived here, rent-free, for years.
Mother, I was a child!
An ungrateful one.

[to Billie]
I gave you life! The least you could do is cheerfully answer the door.

[about the new web page Billie's supposed to take care of]
Are we on the internet yet?
Didn't you hear the internet's closed today?
If anyone can bounce back, it's me; I'm like the Energizer Junkie.

[to Billie]
Hey, the next time you invite me to a family gathering, could you make sure it's not your family!
Come on Dave, please, I need your help, I'm begging you, and I don't usually beg! Well, not with my clothes on, anyway.
Carl, what if I told you I was really drunk last night and... the only reason I slept with you is because, well, I don't know why I slept with you, *but* it's never gonna happen again.

[Billie just arrived at her mother's house]
Oh Billie, would like a frozen Prozac on a stick? Or, as I'd like to call it - Frozac. It's great on those late summer afternoons when you're really depressed.
We're gonna have some dinner, a little dancing, a little laser light show, and then you are gonna get the best fuck you've ever had.
